Legal_Issue: Whether the trademark HAYABUSA applied by Hayabusa Fightwear Inc. causes confusion with Suzuki Motor Corporation's registered trademark HAYABUSA
Evidence_Assessment: New evidence provided by Hayabusa Fightwear Inc. regarding channels of trade
Decision_Outcome: Appeal allowed; Registrar's decision set aside
Burden_of_Proof: Applicant (Hayabusa Fightwear Inc.) to show no likelihood of confusion
Credibility_Factor: Recognition and prior use by Suzuki, but distinct consumer bases
Legal_Rule: A trademark causes confusion if its use is likely to lead consumers to believe the goods are from the same source
Procedural_Issue: Review of administrative decision with new evidence
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged confusion between two identical marks in different markets
Outcome_on_Merits: No confusion due to significantly different channels of trade
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Consideration of new evidence was appropriate
Key_Evidence_Considered: Channels of trade: Suzuki through authorized dealers, Hayabusa targeting MMA enthusiasts
Applicant_Challenge: Refusal of trademark application based on confusion
Defendant_Response: Suzuki opposed registration based on prior use and recognition
Evidence_Type: Commercial use evidence, market segmentation data
Remedy_Sought: Registration of HAYABUSA trademark for Hayabusa Fightwear Inc.
Resolution_Mechanism: Administrative appeal with judicial review elements
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Likelihood of confusion due to identical mark
